abstract: Steven Davidoff Solomon Deal Professor column discusses Federal Reserve's crackdown on merchant banking, noting agency is proposing to ban practice as part of 'take no risk' regulation strategy; points out banks, in curious regulatory turn, would not be allowed to buy and sell nonfinancial companies.

headline.print_headline: Fed Crackdown on Banking Risks Takes a Curious Turn
headline.main: Fed Proposes Ban on Merchant Banking, a Practice With Little Risk

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Despite merchant banking’s storied past as a way to invest in companies, the Federal Reserve is calling for a ban under the guise of tamping down risk....
lead_paragraph: Despite merchant banking’s storied past as a way to invest in companies, the Federal Reserve is calling for a ban under the guise of tamping down risk.
